body:
Sorry, we won't be using https://godoc.org/github.com/itsmontoya/escapist ... it has very lacking documentation, for one.

> Escape likes to escape

Doesn't end in a period.
It "likes" to escape?
How does it escape?
Does it mutate its argument?
Does it always return a copy? Can it return its input unchanged if there's nothing to escape?
Why is there a whole package for this if not for allocation reductions, yet this returns copies of data? Or does it work like append? It's undocumented.

> EscapeAdv likes to escape very thoroguhly

What does that mean!?

If we need to make escaping faster in the standard library, we'll fix the standard library when the problem has been identified.

But switching to an ill-specified external library is not the answer at the moment.
